alert.note: Alert for Henry; Jefferson; Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 07 at 7:06PM CDT until May 07 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Henry County in southeastern Iowa... Northeastern Van Buren County in southeastern Iowa... Southeastern Jefferson County in southeastern Iowa... Northern Lee County in southeastern Iowa... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 706 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Birmingham, or 9 miles north of Keosauqua, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Stockport, Utica and Morris Park around 710 PM CDT. Hillsboro and Bentonsport/Vernon around 715 PM CDT. Bonaparte and Salem around 720 PM CDT. Houghton and Mt Hamill around 725 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include West Point, Donnellson, Franklin, St. Paul, Pilot Grove, Primrose, Lee County Fairgrounds, Wilson Lake and Shimek State Forest. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Wind damage with this storm will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
